trans-unit.source: Special tile templates are unique templates that are either animated, or just allow you to do things that aren't possible with adaptive tiles.
trans-unit.target: Special tile templates are unique templates that are either animated, or just allow you to do things that aren't possible with adaptive tiles.

trans-unit.source: Special tile templates
trans-unit.target: Special tile templates

trans-unit.source: Special tile templates
trans-unit.target: Special tile templates

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: Special tile templates are unique templates that are either animated, or just allow you to do things that aren't possible with adaptive tiles.
trans-unit.target: Special tile templates are unique templates that are either animated, or just allow you to do things that aren't possible with adaptive tiles.

trans-unit.source: Each special tile template was specifically built for Windows 10, except for the iconic tile template, a classic special template that has been updated for Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Each special tile template was specifically built for Windows 10, except for the iconic tile template, a classic special template that has been updated for Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: This article covers three special tile templates: Iconic, Photos, and People.
trans-unit.target: This article covers three special tile templates: Iconic, Photos, and People.

trans-unit.source: Iconic tile template
trans-unit.target: Iconic tile template

trans-unit.source: The iconic template (also known as the "IconWithBadge" template) lets you display a small image in the center of the tile.
trans-unit.target: The iconic template (also known as the "IconWithBadge" template) lets you display a small image in the center of the tile.

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 supports the template on both phone and tablet/desktop.
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 supports the template on both phone and tablet/desktop.

trans-unit.source: small and medium mail tiles
trans-unit.target: small and medium mail tiles

trans-unit.source: How to create an iconic tile
trans-unit.target: How to create an iconic tile

trans-unit.source: The following steps cover everything you need to know to create an iconic tile for Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: The following steps cover everything you need to know to create an iconic tile for Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: At a high level, you need your iconic image asset, then you send a notification to the tile using the iconic template, and finally you send a badge notification that provides the number to be displayed on the tile.
trans-unit.target: At a high level, you need your iconic image asset, then you send a notification to the tile using the iconic template, and finally you send a badge notification that provides the number to be displayed on the tile.

trans-unit.source: developer flow of iconic tile
trans-unit.target: developer flow of iconic tile

trans-unit.source: Step 1: Create your image assets in PNG format
trans-unit.target: Step 1: Create your image assets in PNG format

trans-unit.source: Create the icon assets for your tile and place those in your project resources with your other assets.
trans-unit.target: Create the icon assets for your tile and place those in your project resources with your other assets.

trans-unit.source: At a bare minimum, create a 200x200 pixel icon, which works for both small and medium tiles on phone and desktop.
trans-unit.target: At a bare minimum, create a 200x200 pixel icon, which works for both small and medium tiles on phone and desktop.

trans-unit.source: To provide the best user experience, create an icon for each size.
trans-unit.target: To provide the best user experience, create an icon for each size.

trans-unit.source: See sizing details in the below image.
trans-unit.target: See sizing details in the below image.

trans-unit.source: Save icon assets in PNG format and with transparency.
trans-unit.target: Save icon assets in PNG format and with transparency.

trans-unit.source: On Windows Phone, every non-transparent pixel is displayed as white (RGB 255, 255, 255).
trans-unit.target: On Windows Phone, every non-transparent pixel is displayed as white (RGB 255, 255, 255).

trans-unit.source: For consistency and simplicity, use white for desktop icons as well.
trans-unit.target: For consistency and simplicity, use white for desktop icons as well.

trans-unit.source: Windows 10 on tablet, laptop, and desktop only supports square icon assets.
trans-unit.target: Windows 10 on tablet, laptop, and desktop only supports square icon assets.

trans-unit.source: Phone supports both square assets and assets that are taller than they are wide, up to a 2:3 width:height ratio, which is useful for images such as a phone icon.
trans-unit.target: Phone supports both square assets and assets that are taller than they are wide, up to a 2:3 width:height ratio, which is useful for images such as a phone icon.

trans-unit.source: icon sizing on small and medium tiles, on phone and desktop
trans-unit.target: icon sizing on small and medium tiles, on phone and desktop

trans-unit.source: Step 2: Create your base tile
trans-unit.target: Step 2: Create your base tile

trans-unit.source: You can use the iconic template on both primary and secondary tiles.
trans-unit.target: You can use the iconic template on both primary and secondary tiles.

trans-unit.source: If you're using it on a secondary tile, you'll first have to create the secondary tile or use an already-pinned secondary tile.
trans-unit.target: If you're using it on a secondary tile, you'll first have to create the secondary tile or use an already-pinned secondary tile.

trans-unit.source: Primary tiles are implicitly pinned and can always be sent notifications.
trans-unit.target: Primary tiles are implicitly pinned and can always be sent notifications.

trans-unit.source: Step 3: Send a notification to your tile
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Send a notification to your tile

trans-unit.source: Although this step can vary based on whether the notification is sent locally or via server push, the XML payload that you send remains the same.
trans-unit.target: Although this step can vary based on whether the notification is sent locally or via server push, the XML payload that you send remains the same.

trans-unit.source: To send a local tile notification, create a [**TileUpdater**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208628) for your tile (either primary or secondary tile), then send a notification to the tile that uses the iconic tile template as seen below.
trans-unit.target: To send a local tile notification, create a [**TileUpdater**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208628) for your tile (either primary or secondary tile), then send a notification to the tile that uses the iconic tile template as seen below.

trans-unit.source: Ideally, you should also include bindings for wide and large tile sizes using [adaptive tile templates](tiles-and-notifications-adaptive-tiles-schema.md).
trans-unit.target: Ideally, you should also include bindings for wide and large tile sizes using [adaptive tile templates](tiles-and-notifications-adaptive-tiles-schema.md).

trans-unit.source: Here's sample code for the XML payload:
trans-unit.target: Here's sample code for the XML payload:

trans-unit.source: This iconic tile template XML payload uses an image element that points to the image that you created in Step 1.
trans-unit.target: This iconic tile template XML payload uses an image element that points to the image that you created in Step 1.

trans-unit.source: Now your tile is ready to display the badge next to your icon; all that's left is sending badge notifications.
trans-unit.target: Now your tile is ready to display the badge next to your icon; all that's left is sending badge notifications.

trans-unit.source: Step 4: Send a badge notification to your tile
trans-unit.target: Step 4: Send a badge notification to your tile

trans-unit.source: As with step 3, this step can vary based on whether the notification is sent locally or via server push, yet the XML payload that you send remains the same.
trans-unit.target: As with step 3, this step can vary based on whether the notification is sent locally or via server push, yet the XML payload that you send remains the same.

trans-unit.source: To send a local badge notification, create a [**BadgeUpdater**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208537) for your tile (either primary or secondary tile), then send a badge notification with your desired value (or clear the badge).
trans-unit.target: To send a local badge notification, create a [**BadgeUpdater**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208537) for your tile (either primary or secondary tile), then send a badge notification with your desired value (or clear the badge).

trans-unit.source: Here's sample code for the XML payload:
trans-unit.target: Here's sample code for the XML payload:

trans-unit.source: The tile's badge will update accordingly.
trans-unit.target: The tile's badge will update accordingly.

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Putting it all together
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Putting it all together

trans-unit.source: The following image illustrates how the various APIs and payloads are associated with each aspect of the iconic tile template.
trans-unit.target: The following image illustrates how the various APIs and payloads are associated with each aspect of the iconic tile template.

trans-unit.source: A [tile notification](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779724) (which contains those <binding> elements) is used to specify the iconic template and the image asset; a [badge notification](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779719) specifies the numerical value; tile properties control your tile's display name, color, and more.
trans-unit.target: A [tile notification](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779724) (which contains those <binding> elements) is used to specify the iconic template and the image asset; a [badge notification](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh779719) specifies the numerical value; tile properties control your tile's display name, color, and more.

trans-unit.source: apis and payloads associated with the iconic tile template
trans-unit.target: apis and payloads associated with the iconic tile template

trans-unit.source: Photos tile template
trans-unit.target: Photos tile template

trans-unit.source: The photos tile template lets you display a slideshow of photos on your live tile.
trans-unit.target: The photos tile template lets you display a slideshow of photos on your live tile.

trans-unit.source: The template is supported on all tile sizes, including small, and behaves the same on each tile size.
trans-unit.target: The template is supported on all tile sizes, including small, and behaves the same on each tile size.

trans-unit.source: The below example shows five frames of a medium tile that uses the photos template.
trans-unit.target: The below example shows five frames of a medium tile that uses the photos template.

trans-unit.source: The template has a zoom and cross-fade animation that cycles through selected photos and loops indefinitely.
trans-unit.target: The template has a zoom and cross-fade animation that cycles through selected photos and loops indefinitely.

trans-unit.source: image slideshow using photos tile template
trans-unit.target: image slideshow using photos tile template

trans-unit.source: How to use the photos template
trans-unit.target: How to use the photos template

trans-unit.source: Using the photos template is easy if you've installed the [Windows 10 version of NotificationExtensions](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/tiles_and_toasts/archive/2015/08/20/introducing-notificationsextensions-for-windows-10.aspx).
trans-unit.target: Using the photos template is easy if you've installed the [Windows 10 version of NotificationExtensions](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/tiles_and_toasts/archive/2015/08/20/introducing-notificationsextensions-for-windows-10.aspx).

trans-unit.source: Although you can use raw XML, we highly recommend going with NotificationExtensions so that you don't have to worry about generating valid XML or XML-escaping content.
trans-unit.target: Although you can use raw XML, we highly recommend going with NotificationExtensions so that you don't have to worry about generating valid XML or XML-escaping content.

trans-unit.source: Windows Phone displays up to 9 photos in a slideshow; tablet, laptop, and desktop display up to 12.
trans-unit.target: Windows Phone displays up to 9 photos in a slideshow; tablet, laptop, and desktop display up to 12.

trans-unit.source: For information about sending the tile notification, see the [Send notifications article](tiles-badges-notifications.md).
trans-unit.target: For information about sending the tile notification, see the [Send notifications article](tiles-badges-notifications.md).

trans-unit.source: People tile template
trans-unit.target: People tile template

trans-unit.source: The People app in Windows 10 uses a special tile template that displays a collection of images in circles that slide around vertically or horizontally on the tile.
trans-unit.target: The People app in Windows 10 uses a special tile template that displays a collection of images in circles that slide around vertically or horizontally on the tile.

trans-unit.source: This tile template has been available since Windows 10 Build 10572, and anyone is welcome to use it in their app.
trans-unit.target: This tile template has been available since Windows 10 Build 10572, and anyone is welcome to use it in their app.

trans-unit.source: The People tile template works on tiles of these sizes:
trans-unit.target: The People tile template works on tiles of these sizes:

trans-unit.source: **Medium tile** (TileMedium)
trans-unit.target: **Medium tile** (TileMedium)

trans-unit.source: medium people tile
trans-unit.target: medium people tile

trans-unit.source: **Wide tile** (TileWide)
trans-unit.target: **Wide tile** (TileWide)

trans-unit.source: wide people tile
trans-unit.target: wide people tile

trans-unit.source: **Large tile (desktop only)** (TileLarge)
trans-unit.target: **Large tile (desktop only)** (TileLarge)

trans-unit.source: large people tile
trans-unit.target: large people tile

trans-unit.source: If you're using [NotificationExtensions](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/tiles_and_toasts/archive/2015/08/20/introducing-notificationsextensions-for-windows-10.aspx), all you have to do to make use of the People tile template is create a new *TileBindingContentPeople* object for your *TileBinding* content.
trans-unit.target: If you're using [NotificationExtensions](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/tiles_and_toasts/archive/2015/08/20/introducing-notificationsextensions-for-windows-10.aspx), all you have to do to make use of the People tile template is create a new *TileBindingContentPeople* object for your *TileBinding* content.

trans-unit.source: The *TileBindingContentPeople* class has an Images property where you add your images.
trans-unit.target: The *TileBindingContentPeople* class has an Images property where you add your images.

trans-unit.source: If you're using raw XML, set the *hint-presentation* to "people" and add your images as children of the binding element.
trans-unit.target: If you're using raw XML, set the *hint-presentation* to "people" and add your images as children of the binding element.

trans-unit.source: The following C# code sample assumes that you're using [NotificationExtensions](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/tiles_and_toasts/archive/2015/08/20/introducing-notificationsextensions-for-windows-10.aspx).
trans-unit.target: The following C# code sample assumes that you're using [NotificationExtensions](http://blogs.msdn.com/b/tiles_and_toasts/archive/2015/08/20/introducing-notificationsextensions-for-windows-10.aspx).

trans-unit.source: For the best user experience, we recommend that you provide the following number of photos for each tile size:
trans-unit.target: For the best user experience, we recommend that you provide the following number of photos for each tile size:

trans-unit.source: Medium tile: 9 photos
trans-unit.target: Medium tile: 9 photos

trans-unit.source: Wide tile: 15 photos
trans-unit.target: Wide tile: 15 photos

trans-unit.source: Large tile: 20 photos
trans-unit.target: Large tile: 20 photos

trans-unit.source: Having that number of photos allows for a few empty circles, which means that the tile won't be too visually busy.
trans-unit.target: Having that number of photos allows for a few empty circles, which means that the tile won't be too visually busy.

trans-unit.source: Feel free to tweak the number of photos to get the look that works best for you.
trans-unit.target: Feel free to tweak the number of photos to get the look that works best for you.

trans-unit.source: To send the notification, see [Choose a notification delivery method](tiles-and-notifications-choosing-a-notification-delivery-method.md).
trans-unit.target: To send the notification, see [Choose a notification delivery method](tiles-and-notifications-choosing-a-notification-delivery-method.md).
